segments.text: And y'know what, I just realised, in the last year I've only gone out with two guys, Richard and Julio.
segments.speaker: Monica

segments.text: You gotta help me out here, you gotta set me up, you gotta get me back in the game.
segments.speaker: Monica

segments.text: Well, that shouldn't be a problem. I mean I work in fashion and all I meet are eligible straight men.
segments.speaker: Rachel

segments.text: Pete, can I get you something else?
segments.speaker: Monica

segments.text: Yeah, a slice of cheesecake and-and a date if you're given' 'em out.
segments.speaker: Pete

segments.text: Haven't you and I covered that topic?
segments.speaker: Monica

segments.text: Hmm, come on, you just said to her that you....
segments.speaker: Pete

segments.text: Aww, the only reason you want to go out with me because my blond wig, and the big boobs, and the fact that I serve you food.
segments.speaker: Monica

segments.text: Well, if that were true, I'd dating my Aunt Ruth.
segments.speaker: Pete

segments.text: And the two times we went out were just plain awkward.
segments.speaker: Pete

segments.text: Come on, you think she should go out with me, don't you?
segments.speaker: Pete

segments.text: Well, I mean, are you sure you want to go out with her?
segments.speaker: Rachel

segments.text: I mean that ain't a pretty picture in the morning, y'know what I mean.
segments.speaker: Rachel

segments.text: That wig all in disarray, and boobs flung over the night stand, y'know.
segments.speaker: Rachel

segments.text: I mean really, think about it.
segments.speaker: Monica
